document_title: Umbilical cord membrane adhesion: Causes, signs, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_name: day-ron-bam-mang.json_3_Can the umbilical cord membrane be prevented?
subsection_content:
Doctor Viet Bac said that currently there are no preventive measures because the exact cause of this condition cannot be determined. To minimize the risk, pregnant women need to follow the regular prenatal check-up schedule to get a fetal ultrasound to detect the condition early, if any.
In case a fetal ultrasound detects that the fetus has a membranous umbilical cord, the pregnant woman needs to closely and strictly follow the doctor's pregnancy monitoring and management schedule. The schedule for examination and fetal monitoring can be more dense to help the doctor closely monitor the condition of the fetus and ensure there are no abnormalities in the placenta.
See more: Abnormalities in the placenta during pregnancy
